Title:
Paraeutypella guizhouensis gen. et sp. nov. and Diatrypella
longiasca sp. nov. (Diatrypaceae) from China
Keywords: 3 new taxa, Acer, Diatrypaceae, morphology, phylogeny
Abstract:
Generic delimitation in Diatrypaceae is still unsettled,
as the phylogeny has yet to be resolved with extensive taxon sampling
and sequencing of authentic ex-type cultures. During an investigation of
xylarialean fungi, we collected Paraeutypella guizhouensis gen. et sp.
nov. based on morphology and ITS and β-tubulin combined phylogenies.
Paraeutypella is characterized by 425 perithecia arranged in a stroma,
with 36 sulcate, long ostiolar necks. Paraeutypella citricola comb. nov.
(Basionym: Eutypella citricola) is introduced from Acer sp. from China.
Diatrypella longiasca sp. nov. has long ascospores, 25 ascomata per
stromata compare to other Diatrypella species and distinct
phylogeny.
